intro: Dianthus caryophyllus var. siculus, commonly known as the Sicilian carnation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to deep red, often with a distinctive dark central stripe. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring through early autumn.
